intro: Amaranthus tarraconensis, commonly known as the Pyrenean amaranth, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from green to red, depending on the stage of development. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is adapted to rocky or gravelly soils. Amaranthus tarraconensis is often found in Mediterranean regions and is considered a species of conservation concern due to habitat loss.
